abstract: On 60 Minutes, Leslie Stahl said that presidential candidates “have to be on Facebook.” In fact, Facebook, and other social networks, have had a relatively little impact on the race so far. They are not suited to mass political persuasion any more than they are for other forms of mass advertising.
snippet: On 60 Minutes, Leslie Stahl said that presidential candidates “have to be on Facebook.” In fact, Facebook, and other social networks, have had a relatively little impact on the race so far. They are not suited to mass political persuasion any more...
lead_paragraph: Sunday’s “60 Minutes” feature on Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive of Facebook, hit all the logical bases: privacy, business model, the Beacon miscues and his youth. Only one section struck me as oddly off: the brief section on politics.
